alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 9:56PM CST until March 11 at 10:57AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah affecting Decatur and Hardin Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Savannah...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 372.0 feet, Evacuation road from Big River Plantation Resort is flooded. Most evacuation roads in bottom lands near Savannah are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CST Saturday the stage was 369.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 371.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 372.5 feet on 01/13/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM CST.
